issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Handle recovery of applications in case of auto-created leaf queue mapping

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
My hadoop version 3.1.0. I found that  a problem RM startup failure on recovery as the follow test step:
1.create a user "user1" have the permisson to submit app.
2.use user1 to submit a job ,wait job finished.
3.delete user "user1"
4.restart yarn 
5.the RM restart failed

RM logs:

2018-07-16 16:24:59,708 | INFO | main-EventThread | Initialized root queue root: numChildQueue= 3, capacity=1.0, absoluteCapacity=1.0, usedResources=<memory:0, vCores:0>usedCapacity=0.0, numApps=0, numContainers=0 | CapacitySchedulerQueueManager.java:163
2018-07-16 16:24:59,708 | INFO | main-EventThread | Initialized queue mappings, override: false | UserGroupMappingPlacementRule.java:232

2018-07-16 16:24:59,709 | INFO | main-EventThread | dynamic-resources.xml not found | Configuration.java:2767

fields.summary: RM startup failure on recovery after user deletion

comments.body:
Thanks [~jj336013]

This looks like a valid problm. For user-mapping support, {{groups.getGroups(user).get(0)}} is invoked which caused the pblm. This has to be validated and recovery of such apps should be failed rather failing RM.

cc [~suma.shivaprasad] [~leftnoteasy]

Thanks [~bibinchundatt] for reporting this issue, so what is the behavior after this patch? We're going to fail individual app instead of whole RM, correct? 

[~sunilg], could u help to review and get this patch committed?

[~bibinchundatt]  Thanks for the patch. A couple of minor comments

1. Can we add a log when placement fails even in the recovery phase?
2. testUnknowUserOnRecovery - can you please fix typo to *testUnknownUserOnRecovery* ?

Thank you [~suma.shivaprasad] for review

Uploaded patch handling review comments.

[~leftnoteasy]

After the patch , RM will skip any placeApplication error on recovery.
 So at scheduler side if the queue doesn't exist, application will get killed.(Behaviour prior to autocreate)

Testcase failures seems not related to patch attached
Changes looks fine to me. [~suma.shivaprasad] do you have some more comments on this.
Thanks [~sunilg] and [~bibinchundatt] . Patch LGTM . +1

Incase when queue is already provided, the app will get submitted to the queue specified .. Exception will not be thrown. 

But that is expected and old behaviour too rt ??
Given queue is mentioned, I think we can go ahead. My worry was on recovery logic. On a second thought, i think its not needed to handle as an exception.

On recovery the application context  will have the previously set queueName. At scheduler side if queue doesn't exists the application will get killed. 

Hope i  was  able to clarify your doubt.
Thanks [~bibinchundatt].  +1

Thank you [~sunilg] for review  and +1

Will commit it soon
Attached patch skipping TestPlacementManager which is part of only 3.2 for branch-3.1
